dublinCore.dc:title: 117 HR 7075 RH: Ukrainian Independence Park Act of 2022
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Spartz (for herself, Ms. Kaptur, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. Quigley, Mr. Harris, Mr. Westerman, Mr. Grijalva, Mr. Gibbs, Mr. Wittman, Mr. Curtis, Miss González-Colón, Mr. Diaz-Balart, Mr. Burgess, Mr. Rutherford, Mr. Balderson, Mr. Peters, Mr. Fortenberry, Mr. Walberg, Mrs. Bice of Oklahoma, Mr. Young, Mr. Danny K. Davis of Illinois, Ms. Norton, Mr. Doggett, Mr. Correa, Mr. Smith of Nebraska, Mrs. Radewagen, Mr. Kinzinger, Mr. Pallone, Mr. Lucas, Mr. LaMalfa, Ms. Salazar, Mr. Moore of Utah, Mr. Armstrong, Ms. Herrera Beutler, Mr. Stauber, Mr. Owens, Mr. McClintock, Mrs. Kim of California, Mr. Estes, Mr. Hudson, Mr. Carter of Georgia, Mrs. Miller-Meeks, Mr. Latta, Mr. LaTurner, Mr. Morelle, Mr. Gohmert, Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York, Mr. Loudermilk, Mr. Kilmer, Mr. Beyer, Ms. Eshoo, Mr. Gallego, Ms. Dean, Mr. Swalwell, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Ruiz, Mrs. Murphy of Florida, Mr. Ferguson, Ms. Wild, Ms. Jackson Lee, Mr. Rodney Davis of Illinois, Ms. Speier, Mr. Garbarino, Mr. O'Halleran, Mr. Khanna, Mr. Reschenthaler, Ms. Cheney, Mr. Mann, Mr. Johnson of Ohio, Mr. Raskin, Mr. Norman, Mr. Green of Texas, Mr. Crow, Mr. Tony Gonzales of Texas, Mr. Mullin, Mr. Mast, Ms. Stefanik, Mrs. Rodgers of Washington, Mrs. Hinson, Ms. Tenney, Mr. Schiff, Mr. Joyce of Ohio, Mr. Levin of Michigan, Mr. McKinley, Mr. Crenshaw, Mr. Jacobs of New York, Mr. Meijer, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Vargas, Ms. Malliotakis, Mr. Espaillat, Mr. Calvert, Mr. Lamborn, Mr. Trone, Mr. Cuellar, Ms. Matsui, Mr. Krishnamoorthi, Ms. Schakowsky, Mr. Bowman, Mr. Welch, Mr. Schrader, Mr. Carson, and Mr. Guest) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

Additional sponsors: Mr. Bucshon, Mr. Graves of Louisiana, Mr. Smith of New Jersey, Mrs. Demings, Mr. Kind, Mr. Wenstrup, Mr. Austin Scott of Georgia, Mr. Mooney, Mr. Golden, Mr. Weber of Texas, Mr. Bentz, Ms. DeGette, Mr. Johnson of Louisiana, Mrs. Lee of Nevada, Mr. Gottheimer, and Mr. Ryan of Ohio
Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on March 15, 2022

form.official-title: To designate Ukrainian Independence Park in Washington, District of Columbia, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Ukrainian Independence Park Act of 2022.

paragraph.text: The area described in paragraph (2) shall be designated as Ukrainian Independence Park.

The area designated under paragraph (1) is the approximately 0.35 acres generally depicted as Ukrainian Independence Park on the map entitled Ukrainian Independence Park Proposed Boundary, numbered 802/180,561, and dated June 2022.

subsection.text: Any reference in any law, regulation, document, record, map, paper, or other record of the United States to the area or properties described in subsection (a) is deemed to be a reference to Ukrainian Independence Park.

The Secretary of the Interior may post signs on or near Ukrainian Independence Park that include information on the importance of Ukraine’s independence, freedom, and sovereignty and the solidarity between the people of Ukraine and the United States.

bill.official-title-amendment: Amend the title so as to read: A bill to designate the area surrounding the Taras Shevchenko Memorial in Washington, District of Columbia, as Ukrainian Independence Park, and for other purposes..

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with amendments, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
